musicalLanguage.description: Elton John's spacefaring ballad, built on lush piano chords with a soaring melody. The verse uses a Bb-based progression with unexpected chromatic touches that evoke the weightlessness of space. This arrangement captures the dreamy, floating quality of the original piano part.
musicalLanguage.structure: Verse (8 bars) — Bb-Gm-Cm-F-Eb-Bb with melodic ascent and descent
keyMoments: Bars 1-2: Bb to Gm — the warm opening that establishes the reflective mood
Bars 3-4: Cm to F — the classic ii-V motion that gives the phrase momentum
Bars 7-8: Eb to Bb — the plagal-flavored resolution, spacious and open
teachingGoals: Playing in Bb major with two flats
Rich chord voicings in Elton John's style
Balancing a singing melody with supportive chordal accompaniment
styleTips: Play with a floating, weightless quality — this is music about space travel
The chords should ring and overlap slightly, creating a lush wash of sound
Melody should soar above the chords like a voice — Elton always thinks vocally

measures.leftHand: Bb2:e F3:e Bb3:e F3:e Bb2:e F3:e Bb3:e F3:e
measures.teachingNote: Bb major — the warm, expansive opening. Left hand rolls gently beneath the melody.

measures.leftHand: G2:e D3:e G3:e D3:e G2:e D3:e G3:e D3:e
measures.teachingNote: G minor — the melody arches upward then back. The minor chord adds longing.

measures.leftHand: C3:e G3:e C3:e G3:e C3:e G3:e C3:e G3:e
measures.teachingNote: C minor — the ii chord. The melody dips to Eb, the darkest moment of the phrase.

measures.leftHand: F2:e C3:e F3:e C3:e F2:e C3:e F3:e C3:e
measures.teachingNote: F major — the V chord. Melody rises to C5, reaching for the sky. Literally.

measures.leftHand: Bb2:e F3:e Bb3:e F3:e Bb2:e F3:e Bb3:e F3:e
measures.teachingNote: Bb major — melody descends gently. The floating feeling of re-entry.

measures.leftHand: G2:e D3:e G3:e D3:e G2:e D3:e G3:e D3:e
measures.teachingNote: G minor — one more rise to Bb4. The melody has a gentle orbital quality.

measures.leftHand: Eb2:e Bb2:e Eb3:e Bb2:e Eb2:e Bb2:e Eb3:e Bb2:e
measures.teachingNote: Eb major — the IV chord. Ab4 adds a bluesy touch. The phrase is coming home.
Bb major — the melody settles to rest on the tonic. Touchdown.
